sub_title: Chief People Officer | CHRO at Swapfiets
summary:
Throughout my career, I have met many talented people. Some of those talents have been more successful and more happy than others. Why?

I strongly believe that it is all about: 
- surrounding yourself with great leaders & people where you can learn from 
- taking on courageous challenges supported by those great leaders
- chosing for an environment that empowers you to excel
- and not taking things too seriously, have a laugh with the people on your journey 

I am passionate about empowering talents, teams and leaders so that organisations not only bring great results but also create a better and happier 'working world'. 

Besides, I am confident that every organisation can make things happen whilst keeping the employee experience a magical and joyful journey.

treasury_media.title: CHRO magazine article: “Employee engagement is de motor van de organisatie, het kompas waarop we varen.” - CHRO.nl
treasury_media.description: Het werkzame leven van Daniёlle van Alewijn nam begin 2020 een flinke wending. Bij het grote en gevestigde FrieslandCampina was alles op de HR-afdeling in kannen en kruiken, bij Swapfiets ging ze pionieren. Na jaren fors investeren heeft de scale-up nu de weg ingezet naar winstgevendheid, en als CHRO begeleidt zij die ontwikkeling zorgvuldig.

treasury_media.title: Expedition Company Culture - Danielle van Alewijn
treasury_media.description: Podcast with Ernst Schipper about how our journey looked like at Swapfiets about our company values.

treasury_media.title: HR community Tuesday Talk #9 met Daniëlle van Alewijn over Sustainable HR bij Swapfiets
treasury_media.description:
Om de maand presenteren onze leden hun expertise en verhaal in de vorm van een webinar tijdens de Tuesday Talks. Danielle van Alewijn, CHRO bij Swapfiets was in 2022 de HRtop100 runner-up van zowel de Wildcard als de Publieksprijs.

Swapfiets is ‘s werelds eerste ‘bike as a service’ bedrijf met een circulair businessmodel. De organisatie mag zich sinds 2022 een B Corp noemen. Dit betekent dat de strategische agenda van Swapfiets voor een groot deel wordt beïnvloed door sustainability.

treasury_media.title: How Swapfiets captured its culture whilst growing at hyper speed
treasury_media.description:
To us, culture is way more than just creating a nice environment to work in. It is all about sharing the right principles of how we work and how we make daily decisions. When Swapfiets was founded in 2014 by three technical students in Delft, the key idea was to really focus on one clear customer need: hassle free access to bikes. From the start, our founders have always cultivated these values and made them the core of the Swapfiets cultural DNA. 

https://www.getsumm.co/blog/the-culture-factor-swapfiets

authors.headline: Chief People Officer | CHRO at Swapfiets
Chief People Officer | CHRO at Swapfiets
Chief People Officer | CHRO at Swapfiets

profile_positions.description: In my role as Chief People Officer (CHRO), I am end responsible for all HR topics within Swapfiets. Leading a team of 25 HR professionals, member of the Management Board, reporting into the CEO. Experience gained in: managing Covid-19 crisis, leading a reorganization process, changing the reward and performance system, rolling out continuous learning & continuous dialogue, introducing talent reviews and succession planning, conducting employee surveys and dialogue days, designing updated company values, setting up a talent acquisition team, deploying a new HR infrastructure based on employee journeys, facilitating international growth in NL, BE, GE, DK, FR, UK, IT, ES and AT, reshaping office experience, aligning goal management with OKRs, streamlining workforce planning, launching HR business reviews based on key HR metrics / reporting and so forth and so forth…
profile_positions.title: CHRO | Chief People Officer

profile_positions.description:
In my global HR role I aim to add value to the business objectives of FC Ingredients Go to Market (reporting into Managing Directors and BG HRD). I also act as the HR business partner for Creamy Creation, Sales (Excellence), Product Strategy & SUMMIT. I lead 4 Regional HR offices (China, APAC, USA and LATAM). End responsible for all people topics, e.g. talent management, employee engagement and change management. 

I am part of the Management Team of Adult Nutrition + Food&Beverages & part of the HR MT for Ingredients. I lead the Talent Council for all senior B2B talents within FC, which includes capability building.

In my role, I have been exposed to: a reorganisation, a divestment / carve out, new capability building program and instilling a new way of agile working, impacting the whole business group.

As MBTI & Facet5 practitioner and internal facilitator for our Leadership programs, I also facilitate/coach teams, individuals and leaders all over the world.
profile_positions.title: Global HRBP FrieslandCampina Ingredients

profile_positions.description:
FrieslandCampina's ability to attract and retain top talent is key for our success as a company. Given the long term ambition to fill 75% of senior management positions from within, it is important to fill our internal pipelines with top talent across different levels. This means an appealing employer value proposition and a well thought out recruitment approach. I am responsible to design and activate our global employer value proposition and to ensure local countries are able to execute local employer branding. Also, I am responsible to design and deploy our global applicant tracking system together with our global career website. Besides, I am responsible to set global standards to bring our (global) talent acquisition practices, processes and policies to a higher level. 

As global talent manager, I am responsible to further improve and accelerate the identification, growth and development of  high potential talent within FrieslandCampina, in order to support the objective to fill senior management positions mainly from within. I advise the global Talent Council on the global talent strategy, based on expected development of business and organization, and based on quality and demographics of current global talent pipelines. I continuously monitor and report on global Talent Management KPI’s, address challenges and propose action to take. I ensure clarity of career paths and I coordinate and support the global talent council in the talent review and succession planning process. My main focus is on identification of high potentials & succession planning for senior management positions. I also maintain dialogue with future leaders and other high potentials, with emphasis on their growth on-the-job and towards new roles and challenges. Besides, I manage key global leadership development programs: design, partnering with external parties, financial result & delivery of global programs. I am also responsible for the topic 'diversity'.
profile_positions.title: Global Manager Talent Acquisition & Talent Management

profile_positions.description:
In my role I am responsible to bring Booking.com's recruitment & employer branding to even a higher level than it already is. I chose to work for Booking because of the fabulous concept, the engaging atmosphere, the opportunity I have been given to develop myself, the freedom and responsibility I get and because of the bright and incredibly nice people. If you join Booking.com, you feel that you are part of a 'winning team'. For me, that was the reason to join Booking.com.

Booking.com is highly international, with a HQ in Amsterdam and over 150 offices all over the world: in the greatest cities you can imagine. I am very glad to be part of the Global Recruitment Team of Booking.com who do a great job in hiring the best people in IT, Customer Service, Account Management, Product development, Finance and lots of other exciting roles. In my current role, I am also a member of the HR Leadership team, reporting to the HR Director.

Find out more: http://www.workingatbooking.com/. 

Despite from getting the best and nicest colleagues into Booking, I also focus on employer branding, campus recruitment, game changing selection and assessment, system and process optimization, employability, sourcing mix and vendor relations. I created a team of process recruiters and innovation specialists / product owners so that there is focus on execution and innovation/optimization at all times. The goal is to spread the word about Booking.com in order to attract the best and right talent, a segmented way of selection & assessment, aiming for the highest candidate experience (since every candidate is a customer as well!) and to create great relationships with the business & outside. All initiatives should be scalable, in alignment with the regional heads of HR & the business and measurable: a data-driven approach in determining the innovation agenda, from traffic to the website to internal talent/performance.
profile_positions.title: Global Manager Talent Acquisition

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I am responsible for the growth and reputation of Effectory International, across the globe. By having the best people on board, we have been able to expand further into Europe, the BRIC countries, the USA and other growing markets.  By staying in line with our social value and by acting on client feedback, we are able to continually innovate and develop the Effectory employee survey product. 

I enjoy public speaking across the world about various HR topics: employee engagement, leadership, employability, social value, and so on. We are able to expand our thought leadership through white papers, international labour market studies, PR relations and by staying in constant dialogue with clients and partners.

Check out the animations, in which Effectory is explained (using my voice over 😉).
profile_positions.title: General manager Effectory International

profile_positions.description:
Effectory is a leading supplier of employee and customer surveys in Europe. By gaining insight into all aspects of the intangible side of the organisation (opinions and attitudes of people), our clients can act on trends effectively and are able to perform optimally. Our survey approach and deliverables are focussed on the actual change and improvement. In April 2008, we founded Effectory in the United Kingdom. 

In my role as General Manager I am responsible for the company foundation, strategic market approach, tactical and operational management. This involves business planning, recruitment, sales, marketing and profit & loss management. I report to the board in the Netherlands and my team consists of 4 direct employees and 15 indirect ambassadors.
profile_positions.title: General manager UK

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a Sr Sales Consultant, I am responsible for acquiring new business in the Netherlands and Belgium. My clients can be found in the field of HR (e.g. HR Directors and HR professionals), Commerce (e.g. sales, marketing), Management (e.g. CEOs, MDs, MTs) and PR & Communications. 

In my opinion, my success factors are: my thorough advising skills, transparency, genuinity and the way I stand for the company.
profile_positions.title: Senior Sales Consultant

profile_positions.description: Helping WUA! in its stage of setting up and growing the business. I mainly coached the executive board in sales, marketing, process development, leadership and brand positioning.
profile_positions.title: Sales, marketing & operational management coach

profile_positions.description:
Operating as a mediator between the international breweries, the customers, shipping/trucking companies and internal departments.

Besides, I was also the project manager of an internal communications project.

Moreover, I managed two other projects. First of all, the establishment of the B2B website for Heineken's duty free and travel retail customers. Secondly, I conducted research and wrote a business plan on how to improve the marketing communications in the shipping industry resulting in a higher volume and value.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description: Being a sparring partner and business advisor for the Hogeschool van Amsterdam so that the educational material is well aligned with the requirements of the business field.
